messageBody:
>>Hello All,
>>
>>I'm curious how many JUnit users want a way to temporarily mark certain
>>test methods so that the runner doesn't execute them, but reports that
>>they are skipped. This is a functionality that Vladimir R. Bossicard
>>provides via his JUnit Add-Ons runner, which he describes in his first
>>blog post:
>>
>>http://www.artima.com/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=4603
>>
>>I'm considering whether or not it makes sense to do something similar
>>for SuiteRunner, and I'd like to know what JUnit users would really
>>want. If you do want something like this, for what specific use cases
>>do you imagine you'd use it?


Yes. It's useful for working against a bug (isolate the relevant
cases, disable irrelevant tests, fix the bug, renable the tests),
*but* only if the run annoys me about how many tests have been
switched off:

DISABLED!

you get the idea; it has to be as annoying as a failure. Otherwise I
can just use comments.

(btw, red text on a yellow background is intensely irritating)
